column4: can somebody help me install keepassx, https://launchpad.net/~keepassx/+archive/ppa
i don't know how to install this ppa thing, and the gpg and asc files
not that complicated but Iets see. No, no login needed
first add the repository lines. Open synaptic, go to settings > repositories
then from https://launchpad.net/~keepassx/+archive/ppa click the key 1024R etcetera
you copied to textfile and imported it?
ok, then reload database and find your package and install, if no errors / warnings about keys it's ok
in synaptic main window click reload or in terminal sudo apt-get update
ok post here or use pastebin if it's long and multiline text
you pasted this as key in text editor and imported? http://paste.ubuntu.com/169114/

no, I don't know, it's what I got when I clicked the key for your package. You use jaunty? It may be different each time, don't know. At least if you trust the package install it, the warning is just a warning, not an error
yes, with sudo, but check ubuntuforums there is a script that fixes your repo keys problem, I'll go look for it

the warnings were for other repositories than keepassx; to fix use the first post of this thread http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1056099&highlight=ppa+keys but even better is do it yourself and understand what needs to be done
ok, bookmark the link I gave and sleep well
machine; but if you want to change it use 'about me' in the menus
